Reviews.Title: Absurdly overpriced "license" to RESTORE access to immature beta software
Reviews.Author: J. Nelson
Reviews.Content: Synology manufactures some of the best network-attached storage (NAS) devices around, and has spent considerable resources making the user interface for their devices convenient, intuitive and powerful.  Among the software features bundled with their NAS operating system is a "Surveillance Station" software package, which can, when used with one or more IP cameras, turn the Diskstation into an internet-enabled video security system.While the ad copy for the Diskstations may discuss the maximum number of cameras each of the different models can accommodate, it may not make clear that, out-of-the-box, each Diskstation has a "license" to use only one camera.  You simply can not connect more than one camera to the software without buying a "license" code for each additional camera.  Why Synology would choose to intentionally cripple one of their software titles, and charge such an exorbitant ransom to enable it, escapes me.For example, I have a DS1511+, currently Synology's flagship 5-bay SOHO NAS.  According to Synology's specifications, this device is capable of supporting up to 20 (!) IP cameras.  (The word "support" here is used generously, as very few cameras are fully "supported" -- with many you won't be able to record audio, or stream a live view to anything other than Internet Explorer with ActiveX plugins).  As with every Diskstation, the DS1511+ only includes a "license" for 1 camera.  To fully enable the 20 'supported' cameras, one would have to purchase 19 of the CLP1 license packs.  Do the math (Amazon doesn't like people mentioning prices in their reviews), and you will discover:THE LICENSING COST FOR THE CAMERA SOFTWARE WILL EXCEED THE COST OF THE (EXPENSIVE) DS1511+ HARDWARE!According to the Synology moderators who locked (!) a discussion thread on this topic in their support forums:"The ability to use 1 IP camera per DiskStation out of the box is for evaluation purposes and is not provided as a license key."Therefore, the Surveillance Station software that they advertise so proudly in the ad copy for each of their NAS devices is properly understood as an EVALUATION TRIAL COPY.This came as a surprise to early adopters of Synology products, who previously enjoyed a copy of Surveillance Station that was unburdened by additional camera licensing requirements.  Much to their surprise, a firmware update pushed out by Synology disabled the functionality of their software, and rendered their previous purchases of additional cameras wasted.  Imagine how you would feel if you updated your Windows operating system, only to be told that now you owed Microsoft an additional $50 printer "license" for a device that previously functioned, and was now disabled.Will Synology push out additional firmware updates in the future that disable additional components of their operating system?  Will they begin charging a per-hard-drive "license" fee for their multi-bay units?If history is any indication, they might.Plan your purchases accordingly.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: John Homman
Reviews.Content: Worked fine - but why in the heck do you have to ship a license number?  The number should be able to be downloaded!

Reviews.Title: Unfortunate cost on a decent product from a good company
Reviews.Author: Daniel M
Reviews.Content: I used the trial to see if this was superior to other products. I really like it, extremely easy to use. Unfortunately, it is not a cost effective solution for me. Here's why. I have 7 cameras. 7 * 65 = $455. Instead, I used an old mini desktop and bought 8 licenses from Xeoma for $119. Total savings = $336. I still use my synology NAS for storage (which is what I bought it for originally) and I plan on trying their directory and dns service. The hardware is amazing. The insanely pricey camera licensing? No thanks.

Reviews.Title: Overpriced for a license key
Reviews.Author: tantra invedy
Reviews.Content: I configured 1 foscam camera on the sinology server. Just found out you need additional license to install additional camera. The price of the license is too high for each camera. I am looking for other alternative.

Reviews.Title: Too much for too little value
Reviews.Author: bakerjw "Bakerjw"
Reviews.Content: I would have expected a bit better pricing for a license after spending the amount of money that I spent on a Synology DiskStation DS411. I have multiple IP cameras that are quite capable of connecting to my DS411; however, if I expect to use all 8 of them, I will have to spend more in license fees that I did for the DS411!

Reviews.Title: Nice tool, but lacks essential feature and the price is not justifyable.
Reviews.Author: Trailman
Reviews.Content: I like the Surveillance Station of my Rackstation RS-407, but it is a rather crude implementation of a surveillance camera utility. Synology clearly spent time and effort on making the user interface slick and appealing, not without success. But if you have 3 weeks worth of video material on the disk, how are you going to look for a specific event without a fast-forward playback mechanism?I have to take the video file and view in Windows Media Player. Why spend $50 per additional camera license if I can't even view the recorded video with the onboard software? If the pricing were reasonable, I would buy another license.Update 12/2009: Indeed, version 2.2 of the Disk Station Manager (the web interface that comes with the latest firmware patch) adds up to 8x accelerated and 1/8 x slow motion playback, as well as a digital zoom that an be applied to the recorded video. I still think the licenses are too expensive for the target market of my RS207 - home users and small businesses.

Reviews.Title: Found place where license is send by email
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: I found a website that will send the license to my email in one business day. Ordered it on Saturday and got it by Monday for less money. Worked fine. I now have two webcams working. Its: store.synologyamerica.com/Default.aspx

Reviews.Title: Slightly unhappy
Reviews.Author: JRod
Reviews.Content: For companies who can afford this, it is no big deal.  But I have about a dozen customers with lower-end Synology units and they weren't interested in spending the money for these licenses.  There is no way to purchase these from Synology directly via electronic means.  So you need to wait for days for the license key to show up.  Not cool.  One of the few blemishes with Synology.  I hope they make progress some day.

Reviews.Title: Absurd Price
Reviews.Author: A. Gift To You
Reviews.Content: Price is not justified, works fine, but the price is astronomical. Why do you have to ship a licence number? who does that benefit?DO NOT RECOMMEND, you can buy a whole DVR with cameras and a monitor for the price of 6 camera licences alone

Reviews.Title: I'm disappointed and frustrated with Synology!
Reviews.Author: Brandon B. Jozsa
Reviews.Content: First off, I'll start by saying that the Synology is a great appliance, and I think that everyone should consider a backup solution with similar features. Being a developer, I understand why the appliance is so expensive. There is a lot of customization and thought that goes into the software behind this juggernaut of a backup solution.But I'm frustrated with the licensing for Surveillance Station! It's outrageous to pay $54 for a single license, just in order to add additional security at my home. I guess I'm frustrated with the fact that we have to pay for additional security, peace of mind, and safety. Those things should not be considered luxuries, where company's make people pay exorbitant fees on top of what has already been paid.I have a DS1512+ filled to the brim with 5 3TB Seagate Server Grade hard disks, and the extra 2GB memory module. The solution is flawless, and I really appreciate everything that Synology has done in order to make such a great product. Even this license, works as advertised. But they need to consider 3 things that I believe would be make it better (and thus, sell more licenses):1. Make it an instant License Code! Go green, please...having to send me this card is a freaking waste now-a-days! Catch up to the 21st century already.2. Make it more reasonable. We're loyal customers, that love your product. Get more people onboard and don't penalize your customer for a stupid license. A new SOFTWARE package, or the software package in general...sure! But a license, that doesn't cost you anything to develop...that's a rip off!3. Make your group licenses (pack of 4) CHEAPER than it would cost to buy a single license! I mean, this is insane...if I bought 4 licenses at a rate of $54 x 4 = $216 (which is what I paid), that would be CHEAPER than buying a 4 pack at $220+.Get with it Synology!! I'm not on the bandwagon anymore...and I'm starting to think your product is a rip-off. I'll be checking out another backup solution soon, just because of these licensing tactics.

Reviews.Title: Synology IP Camera License Pack for 1 (CLP1)
Reviews.Author: Benny B. Imbert "Benny"
Reviews.Content: I think the product itself is okay but is EXTREMELY OVERPRICED. It is quite possible consumers will choose a competitor with the surveillance camera capabilities if knowing they'll go bankrupt purchasing camera license packs.

Reviews.Title: good product - just overpriced
Reviews.Author: PartMusicPartGeek "gadget geek of VT"
Reviews.Content: Not smart Synology!  You'd sell a bunch more for $10 instead of $50. You're leaving $$ on the table.  Very dumb. Try a little more marketing before you price something.  ATTN  Home users:  Need a reasonable alternative that's more reasonable priced?  Just go to  [...] for iPhone and mac or windows.  same quality, same function, fraction of the price.  $5 or around there.  that's more like it.  This program puts the files on your mac or pc (and your iPhone) instead of a NAS - unless of course you configure your mac/pc to record to NAS.  Synology - fix your price on your license.

Reviews.Title: Cost-Effective Add-On for DiskStation's NAS
Reviews.Author: aHoy!! "Papa-K"
Reviews.Content: If you're shocked about the cost, research (the cost & feasibility) of other IP-Cam CCTV hardware/software. It can be very expensive to purchase, install, config & maintain your own CCTV system. That's why so many just buy the 4-Cam or 8-Cam packaged CCTV solutions at the local hardware store -- but they still have to hump around the house to install each camera with individual cable-runs, and learn how their system needs to be configured, etc. These systems are great for consumers who don't know anything about IP-based CCTV systems but if you're reading this review, I'm assuming you're already tech-savvy.I don't work for Synology. I'm an ordinary average guy with a wife who wanted CCTV cameras in the house, and I already owned a DiskStation DS410 NAS device using firmware version "DSM 3.2-1944" with 4x2TB Seagate hard drives. I was surprised DiskStation's firmware had a CCTV Surveillance application already on-board the DS410, and I was also surprised I needed to purchase a license for each additonal CCTV camera I want to install. So, I searched the Internet for similar IP-based CCTV systems and compared cost, etc. I was even more surprised to discover other IP-based camera licenses cost twice as much (or more) than Synology's IP camera license.I now have ten (10) CCTV IP Cameras all over my house connected and managed by my DS410 NAS using Synology's Surveillance Station firmware. Each of my cameras are Chinese imitations of the popular wifi Foscam PTZ models w/night vision. I tried using only wifi for the last 6 months but each IP camera's wifi radio performance was marginal at best. My wife and I also own iPhones and Synology offers a Surveillance Station app from Apple's iTunes online app store. We can monitor every camera in the house from our iPhones including pan, tilt, zoom! I ended-up routing CAT-5 cable to each IP camera and the overall performance of the system is way better! Just make sure to have a good router and network switch. I'm an expat living in the Philippines, so obtaining all of this equipment was not even clost to easy but little-by-little it's all assembled and working 24/7.I only have two complaints about this purchase: (1) each license has to be physically shipped to your address instead of just receiving an email with the license key, and (2) Amazon split my shipping into two separate deliveries [2 different shipping companies] instead of only one EVEN AFTER I SPECIFIED 'GROUP INTO INDIVIDUAL SHIPMENT' upon check-out, which wasn't a big deal but one of the shipping companies lost the delivery and I had to spend hours on the phone overseas to resolve the problem. In that regard, Amazon's shipping policies/procedures have degraded since I first began shopping with them over ten years ago.

Reviews.Title: Overpriced
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: I would never pay this for each camera,for the same price they charge for one camera i get up to 64 cameras. So i just use the diskstation for the storage and ftp server.Foscam Blue Iris Professional Surveillance Software - Up to 64 Cameras, SMS/Text Message Alerts, H.264 Encoding, Supports most major IP Camera brands and CCTV Systems.

Reviews.Title: Cannot Record Continously
Reviews.Author: Kenechukwu Akubue
Reviews.Content: I paid for four license packs for my four camera installations, but it has been almost useless because the diskstation on records short videos that vary between 10seconds and one minute, with varying pauses in between that can last up to ten minutes. Two of my cameras are capable of recording to the NAS directly and they have been recording perfectly by themselves. The license packs appear to be a complete waste of my money until I find a solution. I would have given a no-star rating if that were possible.

Reviews.Title: Works, but come on Synology, how about a more reasonable price.
Reviews.Author: Ted
Reviews.Content: It works just fine, but the price is a bit of a ripoff to simply be able to add a few cameras to your synology.

Reviews.Title: Works fine but pricy
Reviews.Author: Mohammad Alqahtani
Reviews.Content: The key worked fine once installed. My only issue is the price as I see it really high for such product.

Reviews.Title: great product, only wish the price can be more reasonable
Reviews.Author: eFan "eFan"
Reviews.Content: Best surveillance software combined with synology nas, can not have enough. The price is kind of monopoly price and wish it can be more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: Happy with the Surveillance solution from Synology.
Reviews.Author: Grizwald Fubar
Reviews.Content: The licenses work fine and port from server to server if needed. I think most reviewers are baulking at the price. I don't like paying an up charge to add cameras but sadly it's part of the lower price tag of a Synology server. My server rocks. I think I have had it in play for almost a decade now.

Reviews.Title: License expensive but you need if you are connecting more than 1 camera.
Reviews.Author: Bronson D. Kurtz
Reviews.Content: The license themselves worked fine.  The issue is the license cost of the camera license to hook up more than one camera.  The 3 pack is even more expensive per license which is even more frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Seems pretty good - I have bought a few
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Lets you mix and match a bunch of approved cameras.  I don't mind the license fee.  Synology keeps improving it.

Reviews.Title: IP Camera Licsense
Reviews.Author: RMS "RMS"
Reviews.Content: Installed easily and without incident.  Yes, it is overpriced.  I am not sure why.  Perhaps, someday, I will call/write Synology to complain.  In either case, if you love their surveillance station software, and their NAS (which I do), there is little other option besides not using it at all.  Of course, they know this, hence the cost of the license.

Reviews.Title: I didn't like being forced into purchasing this.
Reviews.Author: TofuRobot
Reviews.Content: I'm used to BlueIris, a Windows app that provides DVR functionality for 64+ video devices for a one time fee of around $40.I wanted to give synology a shot at one of our store locations. Big mistake? I like synology hardware and software, and have used it at home, but man, charging for the ability to USE the platform you paid for (anything over the built-in, 1-camera trial license) is greedy. It's weird, too, because Synology provides great services and tools elsewhere in their products. The point is that me adding an IP camera to my network and wanting to record to a box also on my local network doesn't cost Synology anything. If they want to find a way to charge people for their hard work making updates and such, maybe they should charge FOR THOSE UPDATES and leave the users free to use their own hardware as they see fit.I know that I'm beating a dead horse. Just take a look at the other reviews... but hey, my two cents.

Reviews.Title: Easy installation, price too high
Reviews.Author: Rodney Przyborowski
Reviews.Content: The installation of the license and subsequent configuration was very easy.Wish I could give this product more starts but the price point just does not scale well.  Synology should make the license much cheaper then it is.

Reviews.Title: Would get 5 stars if I could download license instead of waiting for the mail....
Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: Why it's 3 instead of 5 stars...Why, Synology, in 2013 can we not purchase and IMMEDIATELY receive these license keys instead of receiving an archaic mailer with the license key?  Wasting you money, wasting me time.Other than that, it's fine....second one I've bought so I knew what to expect.  Seems pricey, but it is what it is.

Reviews.Title: home security with unlimited feature upgrades
Reviews.Author: Chin-Hui  Chang
Reviews.Content: I used it for home security, recording and generate notifications. It is free to keep upgrading surveillance features from Synology.It works for me.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Mauro
Reviews.Content: Hey if you own a Synology DS and don't have a license or two, you are not taking full advantage of your powerful machine. I love my SDS.

Reviews.Title: Pricey but necessary
Reviews.Author: J. Carter
Reviews.Content: Having already spent $$ on the synology box that is now out of support and no more firmware updates I paused on if I wanted to spend the money to add another camera license.  I decided that adding another one vs setting up a totally new system was worth it.  The iphone app does what I need it to do and the software overall does a good job.

Reviews.Title: Synology Disk Station Surveillance Software
Reviews.Author: K. McW "Stuff"
Reviews.Content: I have the Synology Diskstation DS212 to use the Synology Surveillance software.I needed to do surveillance around my home with 1 to 4 cameras.  I bought the DS212 because it gives you one free license for their surveillance software and can support up to 4 cameras (more powerful Disktations can support more cameras).  I did not know much about surveillance camera management software and thought I would try it through the Diskstation.You download the free software for one camera through the Diskstation interface in your computers browser.The software works fine and is a good solution to manage video from surveillance cameras.  The software is in the Diskstation and uses the cpu of the Diskstation.  No need for a PC to manage your cameras.  Synology has apps for Android and iPhone, to view and manage the cameras.  I could view my camera on my phone or tablet.To add two or more cameras, you must pay for a license.I have 3 IP cameras now at home and 3 at my sisters dollar store.  For the Android device I use "IP Cam View".  Free or $5 to have the pro version.  My Toshiba IP surveillance cameras can now be viewed through my Windows PC and Android phone or tablet.  The purpose of the Synology Diskstation on my home surveillance network is to store video from the three cameras.  At the dollar store I use a Buffalo LS-XL Linkstation.  That made the overall cost of the stores surveillance system less as I didn't need the robust features of the Diskstation for storing video there.I deleted the Synology Surveillance software from the Diskstation as I was not using it. Using my PC or IP Camera View on the Android devices is working well.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install, easy to activate.
Reviews.Author: USGrant7 "USGrant7"
Reviews.Content: Synology is a great partner in my Video security world.  I like their solution for our system.  Best in the market. Only wish that it wasn't so darn expensive to add a camera.  You should at least come out with support for 4 cameras.  Just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: just works!
Reviews.Author: Foo
Reviews.Content: in less than 5min i've registered the licence and it's done! you just need to know where to put in the key.

Reviews.Title: Synology
Reviews.Author: Bent
Reviews.Content: I really like the concept of having a NAS that can handle our CCTV as well. I currently have 20 standard cameras on site, I wanted to switch over to IP cameras. I could not justify replaceing our current DVR with one that can handle IP cameras. This is where Synology comes in. So I picked up the DS1511+, I through three 3TB harddrives into it, installed the software, configured my IP camera(which was on the supported list). EVerything worked great. Would I like not having to purchase a camera licence everytime I add a camera? SURE:) Thats not the case, I knew this prior to making the purchase so I can't complain. In the end I have a product that solves both of my issues. Just factor in the cost of how many cameras you intend on installing to get your total cost of the unit.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: James A. King
Reviews.Content: This license key is well worth the money and adds a great deal of value to my DS1812+.I just ordered two more so for now I have a total of four IP cameras on me system. Plus I can purchase more license keys as my needs grow. My NAS model supports a total of 20 cameras.  I just love Synology!!
